sections.body: Prestige classes represent specializations not available to most adventurers, the culmination of extensive practice in a specific field or discipline. The eight prestige classes here supplement those found in Chapter 11 of the Core Rulebook. Always check with your GM to make sure a given prestige class is allowed before working toward it. The prestige classes presented in this chapter include the following.
sections.name: Prestige Classes

sections.body: A veteran whose masterful tactics and air of command inspire allies to greater feats of heroism.
sections.name: Battle Herald
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Battle Herald

sections.body: A pious warrior who spreads religion at the edge of a sword.
sections.name: Holy Vindicator
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Holy Vindicator

sections.body: A scout and wanderer comfortable in even the strangest terrain.
sections.name: Horizon Walker
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Horizon Walker

sections.body: An alchemist whose mutagens create an alternate, brutish personality.
sections.name: Master Chymist
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Master Chymist

sections.body: An espionage expert specializing in disguises and striking swiftly from the shadows.
sections.name: Master Spy
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Master Spy

sections.body: A master of the wilderness bonded spiritually to a fearsome animal companion.
sections.name: Nature Warden
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Nature Warden

sections.body: A bold and barbaric champion who embraces otherworldly powers in order to perfect the art of combat.
sections.name: Rage Prophet
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Rage Prophet

sections.body: A master of defending territory and holding the line at all costs.
sections.name: Stalwart Defender
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Prestige Classes/Stalwart Defender

sections.body: Below are definitions of some common terms used here.
sections.name: Definition of Terms
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Definition of Terms

sections.body: One of the standard eleven classes found in the Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook.
sections.name: Core Class
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Definition of Terms/Core Class

sections.body: A class that progresses from level 1–20.
sections.name: Base Class
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Definition of Terms/Base Class

sections.body: Generally equal to the number of class levels (see below) in a spellcasting class. Some prestige classes add caster levels to an existing class.
sections.name: Caster Level
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Definition of Terms/Caster Level

sections.body: The sum of a character's class levels.
sections.name: Character Level
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Definition of Terms/Character Level

sections.body: The level of a character in a particular class.
sections.name: Class Level
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Prestige Classes/Definition of Terms/Class Level
